Name: Central
Description: A region located in the southern part of Papua New Guinea, known for its agricultural lands and the capital Port Moresby.

Name: Gulf
Description: A coastal region in the southern part of the country, known for its rivers and extensive wetlands.

Name: Madang
Description: A coastal province known for its beautiful beaches, volcanic islands, and rich marine life.

Name: Manus
Description: An island province known for its tropical rainforests, coral reefs, and rich cultural heritage.

Name: Morobe
Description: A province located on the northern coast, home to the city of Lae and various agricultural products.

Name: New Ireland
Description: An island province known for its cultural diversity, beautiful beaches, and the provincial capital of Kavieng.

Name: North Solomon
Description: A province consisting of several islands known for their strategic location and World War II historical sites.

Name: Southern Highlands
Description: A mountainous region rich in natural resources, including oil and gas, as well as a center for the country s cultural traditions.

Name: Western
Description: A province located in the far western part of Papua New Guinea, known for its rugged terrain and dense rainforests.

Name: Western Highlands
Description: A province located in the central highlands, known for its agriculture and the city of Mount Hagen.
